author: Reuters Editorial
title: Putin says state's share in Russian economy must gradually decline
text:
MOSCOW (Reuters) - The Russian stateâ€™s share in the economy must gradually decline, President Vladimir Putin said in a speech to lawmakers on Thursday.
Russian President Vladimir Putin is seen on an electronic screen during his annual state of the nation address to the Federal Assembly in Moscow, Russia March 1, 2018. REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov Putin also said that non-commodity exports should rise to $250 billion by 2024 to boost overall economic growth.
Putin added that the government had to improve the investment climate for the economy to grow.
Reporting by Andrey Ostroukh and Polina Ivanova; writing by Vladimir Soldatkin; editing by Andrew Osborn
